required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Dasatinib (BMS-354825) in Patients With Advanced Estrogen/Progesterone Receptor-positive (ER+/PR+) or Her2/Neu-positive (Her2/Neu+)Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Phase II Study of Dasatinib (BMS-354825) for Advanced Estrogen/Progesterone Receptor-Positive or Her2/Neu-Positive Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This study will determine whether the investigational drug dasatinib is effective in treatment of women with progressive advanced ER+/PR+ or Her2/neu+ breast cancer

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Objective Response
primary_outcome.time_frame: From day of first treatment through Week 25 or at time of discontinuation from study treatment.
primary_outcome.description: Tumor response was assessed according RECIST criteria: PR=at least 30% reduction in the sum of the LD of all target lesions in reference to the baseline sum LD, CR=Disappearance of all non-target lesions. Objective tumor response was defined as a PR or CR.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response
primary_outcome.time_frame: From day of first treatment through Week 25 or at time of discontinuation from study treatment
primary_outcome.description: Tumor response was assessed according RECIST criteria: PR=at least 30% reduction in the sum of the LD of all target lesions in reference to the baseline sum LD, CR=Disappearance of all non-target lesions. Percentage of participants with objective tumor response was determined by the number of participants with PR or CR divided by the total number of response-evaluable participants.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From day of first treatment through Week 25 or at time of discontinuation from study treatment
primary_outcome.description: Response assessed using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria: Complete Response (CR)=disappearance of all target and non-target lesions; Partial Response (PR)=≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter (LD) of target lesions; SD=small changes not meeting above criteria; Progressive Disease (PD)=appearance of new lesion(s), ≥ 20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, or progression of existing non-target lesions; Clinical Progression (cPD)=deterioration related to disease requiring treatment without radiographic PD.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Response-evaluable Participants With Disease Control (DCR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From day of first treatment through Week 25 or at time of discontinuation from study treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Disease control was defined in response-evaluable participants as having a best response of CR or PR (or uPR), or SD at/after 16 Weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Response-evaluable Participants With Disease Control (DCR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From day of first treatment through Week 25 or at time of discontinuation from study treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Disease control was defined in response-evaluable participants as having a best response of objective response (CR or PR) or SD at/after 16 Weeks.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Week 0) to time of PD or discontinuation of last participant from study treatment (Week 45)
secondary_outcome.description: PFS was defined as time from first dosing date until the first date that Progressive Disease (PD) was observed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Week 0) to time of PD or discontinuation of last participant from study treatment (Week 45)
secondary_outcome.description: PFS was defined as time from first dosing date until the first date that PD was observed. The distribution of PFS was estimated using the Kaplan-Meier product limit method. A two-sided 95% confidence interval (Brookmeyer and Crowley method) for the median PFS was computed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Progression-free Survival (PFS) at Weeks 9, 17, and 25
secondary_outcome.description: PFS was defined as time from first dosing date until the first date that progressive disease (PD) was observed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: the time (in weeks) between the first date that criteria for PR were met and the first date that PD or cPD was observed
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of objective response was defined as the time (in weeks) between the first date that criteria for CR or PR were met and the first date that progressive disease (PD) or clinical progressive disease (cPD) was observed. Date of death was used as PD date for participants who died before reporting PD. Participants who neither progressed nor died were censored at the date of their last tumor assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Death, Adverse Events (AEs), and AEs Leading to Discontinuation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Continuous assessment beginning at initiation of study drug until 30 days after the last dose of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. AEs graded according to Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) Version 3.0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With On-study CTCAE Version 3.0 Grade 3-4 Laboratory Abnormalities
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Continuous assessment beginning at initiation of study drug until 30 days after the last dose of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: Normal ranges for laboratory abnormalities: granulocytes=1.5x10^3-8x10^3 mm^3 (range may have varied by institution); hemoglobin=12-16 g/dL; platelets=150-440x10^9c/L; partial thromboplastin time=27-37.1 seconds; alkaline phosphatase=38-126 U/L; alanine aminotransferase=15-48 U/L; aspartate aminotransferase=14-38 U/L; creatine=0.7-1.1 mg/dL; hypokalemia (potassium [K])=3.5-5mEq/L; hyponatremia (sodium [Na])=135-145 mEq/L; phosphorous=2.4-4.5 mg/dL; bilirubin=0-1.2. Grade (Gr) 1=Mild, Gr 2=Moderate, Gr 3=Severe, Gr 4=Life-threatening/disabling, Gr 5=Death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Serious AEs (SAEs), Drug-related AEs, Drug-related SAEs, and Drug-Related Grade 3 AEs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Continuous assessment beginning at initiation of study drug until 30 days after the last dose of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: AEs and SAEs considered possibly, probably, or certainly related to study treatment, graded according to CTCAE Version 3.0 (Grade 1=Mild, Grade 2=Moderate, Grade 3=Severe, Grade 4=Life-threatening or disabling, Grade 5=Death). SAE=any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose: results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number Of Participants With Notable Drug-related AEs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Continuous assessment beginning at initiation of study drug until 30 days after the last dose of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: Notable drug-related AEs for dasatinib include gastrointestinal symptoms (diarrhea, nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain), fatigue, lethargy, headache, rash, fever, pleural effusion, and dyspnea.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Plasma Concentration of Dasatinib at Week 3
secondary_outcome.time_frame: PK assessment was performed at Week 3 visit (Day 15 ±4 days). Blood samples were obtained at Time = 0 hours, and at 1, 3 and 6 hours after each dose, and a trough sample was obtained immediately prior to any dose (~12 hours).
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples (3 mL) were used for measurement of dasatinib plasma concentration and metabolites.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK: Plasma Concentration of Dasatinib at Week 7 or Week 9
secondary_outcome.time_frame: PK assessment was performed at Week 7 or 9 visit. Blood samples were obtained at Time = 0 hours, and at 1, 3 and 6 hours after each dose, and a trough sample was obtained immediately prior to any dose (~12 hours).
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples (3 mL) were used for measurement of dasatinib plasma concentration and metabolites.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamics: Percent Change From Baseline In Plasma Level of Collagen Type IV at Week 3 in Participants With and Without DCR
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Baseline and Week 3 of treatment (Day 15 ±4 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Collagen Type IV is a circulating marker related to the modulation of the vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF)-pathway. An assay of Collagen Type IV in plasma was performed by ELISA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamics: Percent Change From Baseline In Plasma Level of Collagen Type IV at Week 5 in Participants With and Without DCR
secondary_outcome.description: Collagen Type IV is a circulating marker related to the modulation of the vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF)-pathway. An assay of Collagen Type IV in plasma was performed by ELISA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamics: Percent Change From Baseline In Plasma Level of VEGFR2 at Week 3 in Participants With and Without DCR
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Baseline and Week 3 of treatment (Day 15 ±4 days)
secondary_outcome.description: VEGF-stimulated disruption of the cadherin-catenin complex leads to tumor cell invasion and metastasis. VEGFR2 plasma levels were assayed by ELISA as a marker of VEGF pathway modulation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamics: Percent Change From Baseline In Plasma Level of VEGFR2 at Week 5 in Participants With and Without DCR
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Baseline and Week 5 of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: VEGF-stimulated disruption of the cadherin-catenin complex leads to tumor cell invasion and metastasis. VEGFR2 plasma levels were assayed by ELISA as a marker of VEGF pathway modulation.

arm_group.description: Participants with either a Human epidermal growth factor (Her2/neu)-amplified tumor type or ER and/or PgR positive tumor types received oral dasatinib twice daily (BID).

intervention.description: Tablets, Oral, 70 mg, twice daily, as long as the participant benefits (average <6 months)
Tablets, Oral, 100mg, twice daily, as long as the participant benefits (average <6 months)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- females, 18 or older
- recurrent, locally advanced, or metastatic breast cancer with expression of ER/PR receptor and/or overexpression of Her2/neu
- paraffin-embedded tissue block must be available
- measurable disease
- prior chemotherapy with an anthracycline and/or a taxane (neoadjuvant, adjuvant, or metastatic setting)
- 0, 1 or 2 chemotherapies in the metastatic setting
- adequate organ function
Exclusion Criteria:
- Metastatic disease confined to bone only
- Symptomatic central nervous system (CNS) metastasis
- Concurrent medical condition which may increase the risk of toxicity
- Unable to take oral medication

facility.name: University Of North Carolina At Chapel Hill
University Of Texas Md Anderson Cancer Ctr

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link: http://www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

clinical_study.keyword: Recurrent, locally-advanced, or metastatic breast cancer

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 92 participants were enrolled in the study. Twenty-two participants did not enter the treatment phase, 13 because they did not meet entry criteria and 9 for other reasons. The 70 participants treated in the single-arm were stratified by tumor type into Her2-amplified and ER/PgR positive tumors.

group.title: Her2/Neu-amplified Tumor Type
group.description: Participants with a Human epidermal growth factor (Her2/neu)–amplified tumor type (defined as 3+ by immunohistochemistry [IHC] or positive by fluorescent or chromogenic in situ hybridization [FISH or CISH] regardless of estrogen receptor [ER]/progesterone receptor [PgR] status) received orally 100 mg of dasatinib twice daily (BID) for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg.

group.title: ER and/or PgR Positive Tumor Type
group.description: Participants with ER and/or PgR positive tumor types (defined as >10% of cells positive by IHC [unless Her2/neu–amplified]) received orally 100 mg of dasatinib twice daily (BID) for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Adverse event(AE Unrelated to Study Drug

outcome.description: Tumor response was assessed according RECIST criteria: PR=at least 30% reduction in the sum of the LD of all target lesions in reference to the baseline sum LD, CR=Disappearance of all non-target lesions. Objective tumor response was defined as a PR or CR.
outcome.time_frame: From day of first treatment through Week 25 or at time of discontinuation from study treatment.
outcome.population: Evaluable population (n=69): Response Evaluable=treated participants with ≥1 measurable lesion at baseline and ≥1 on-study tumor assessment. One participant was not evaluable (no on-study tumor assessment for other reason).

group.title: Her2/Neu-amplified Tumor, 70 mg Twice Daily (BID) Dasatinib
group.description: Participants with a Human epidermal growth factor (Her2/neu)–amplified tumor type (defined as 3+ by immunohistochemistry [IHC] or positive by fluorescent or chromogenic in situ hybridization [FISH or CISH] regardless of estrogen receptor [ER]/progesterone receptor [PgR] status) received orally 70 mg of dasatinib twice daily (BID) for a total daily dose (TDD) of 140 mg.

group.title: Her2/Neu-amplified Tumor, 100 mg BID
group.description: Participants with a Human epidermal growth factor (Her2/neu)–amplified tumor type (defined as 3+ by immunohistochemistry [IHC] or positive by fluorescent or chromogenic in situ hybridization [FISH or CISH] regardless of estrogen receptor [ER]/progesterone receptor [PgR] status) received orally 100 mg of dasatinib twice daily (BID) for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg.

group.title: ER and/or PgR Positive Tumor, 70 mg BID Dasatinib
group.description: Participants with ER and/or PgR positive tumor types (defined as >10% of cells positive by IHC [unless Her2/neu–amplified]) received orally 70 mg of dasatinib twice daily (BID) for a total daily dose (TDD) of 140 mg.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Objective Response
measure.description: Tumor response was assessed according RECIST criteria: PR=at least 30% reduction in the sum of the LD of all target lesions in reference to the baseline sum LD, CR=Disappearance of all non-target lesions. Objective tumor response was defined as a PR or CR.
measure.population: Evaluable population (n=69): Response Evaluable=treated participants with ≥1 measurable lesion at baseline and ≥1 on-study tumor assessment. One participant was not evaluable (no on-study tumor assessment for other reason).

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response
outcome.description: Tumor response was assessed according RECIST criteria: PR=at least 30% reduction in the sum of the LD of all target lesions in reference to the baseline sum LD, CR=Disappearance of all non-target lesions. Percentage of participants with objective tumor response was determined by the number of participants with PR or CR divided by the total number of response-evaluable participants.

outcome.population: Evaluable population (n=69): Response Evaluable=treated participants with ≥1 measurable lesion at baseline and ≥1 on-study tumor assessment; Non-responders=treated participants with no on-study tumor response assessment due to rapid disease progression/dasatinib toxicity. One participant was not evaluable (no on-study tumor assessment).

outcome.title: Duration Of Objective Response
outcome.description: Duration of objective response was defined as the time (in weeks) between the first date that criteria for CR or PR were met and the first date that progressive disease (PD) or clinical progressive disease (cPD) was observed. Date of death was used as PD date for participants who died before reporting PD. Participants who neither progressed nor died were censored at the date of their last tumor assessment.
outcome.time_frame: the time (in weeks) between the first date that criteria for PR were met and the first date that PD or cPD was observed
outcome.population: Of 69 response-evaluable participants, three had an objective response of PR.

group.title: Participant CA180088-18-88009, HER-2 Group
group.description: Participant with Human epidermal growth factor (Her2/neu)–amplified tumor type (also positive for ER and PgR) who received 100 mg dasatinib BID.

group.title: Participant CA180088-16-88002, ER and/or PgR Group
group.description: Participant with ER and PgR–amplified tumor type who received 100 mg dasatinib BID

group.title: Participant CA180088-29-88085, ER and/or PgR Group
group.description: Participant with ER and PgR–amplified tumor type who received 70 mg dasatinib BID

measure.title: Duration Of Objective Response
measure.description: Duration of objective response was defined as the time (in weeks) between the first date that criteria for CR or PR were met and the first date that progressive disease (PD) or clinical progressive disease (cPD) was observed. Date of death was used as PD date for participants who died before reporting PD. Participants who neither progressed nor died were censored at the date of their last tumor assessment.
measure.population: Of 69 response-evaluable participants, three had an objective response of PR.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Death, Adverse Events (AEs), and AEs Leading to Discontinuation
outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. AEs graded according to Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) Version 3.0.
outcome.time_frame: Continuous assessment beginning at initiation of study drug until 30 days after the last dose of study drug
outcome.population: All-Treated participants: All participants who received at least one dose of dasatinib.

group.title: Dasatinib 70 mg
group.description: Dasatinib was administered orally at 70 mg BID, for a TDD of 140 mg.

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg
group.description: Dasatinib was administered orally at 100 mg BID, for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Death, Adverse Events (AEs), and AEs Leading to Discontinuation
measure.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. AEs graded according to Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) Version 3.0.
measure.population: All-Treated participants: All participants who received at least one dose of dasatinib.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With On-study CTCAE Version 3.0 Grade 3-4 Laboratory Abnormalities
outcome.description: Normal ranges for laboratory abnormalities: granulocytes=1.5x10^3-8x10^3 mm^3 (range may have varied by institution); hemoglobin=12-16 g/dL; platelets=150-440x10^9c/L; partial thromboplastin time=27-37.1 seconds; alkaline phosphatase=38-126 U/L; alanine aminotransferase=15-48 U/L; aspartate aminotransferase=14-38 U/L; creatine=0.7-1.1 mg/dL; hypokalemia (potassium [K])=3.5-5mEq/L; hyponatremia (sodium [Na])=135-145 mEq/L; phosphorous=2.4-4.5 mg/dL; bilirubin=0-1.2. Grade (Gr) 1=Mild, Gr 2=Moderate, Gr 3=Severe, Gr 4=Life-threatening/disabling, Gr 5=Death.
outcome.time_frame: Continuous assessment beginning at initiation of study drug until 30 days after the last dose of study drug
outcome.population: All-Treated participants: All participants who received at least one dose of dasatinib.

group.title: Dasatinib 70 mg
group.description: Dasatinib was administered orally at 70 mg BID, for a TDD of 140 mg.

group.description: Dasatinib was administered orally at 100 mg BID, for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg.

measure.title: Number of Participants With On-study CTCAE Version 3.0 Grade 3-4 Laboratory Abnormalities
measure.description: Normal ranges for laboratory abnormalities: granulocytes=1.5x10^3-8x10^3 mm^3 (range may have varied by institution); hemoglobin=12-16 g/dL; platelets=150-440x10^9c/L; partial thromboplastin time=27-37.1 seconds; alkaline phosphatase=38-126 U/L; alanine aminotransferase=15-48 U/L; aspartate aminotransferase=14-38 U/L; creatine=0.7-1.1 mg/dL; hypokalemia (potassium [K])=3.5-5mEq/L; hyponatremia (sodium [Na])=135-145 mEq/L; phosphorous=2.4-4.5 mg/dL; bilirubin=0-1.2. Grade (Gr) 1=Mild, Gr 2=Moderate, Gr 3=Severe, Gr 4=Life-threatening/disabling, Gr 5=Death.
measure.population: All-Treated participants: All participants who received at least one dose of dasatinib.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Serious AEs (SAEs), Drug-related AEs, Drug-related SAEs, and Drug-Related Grade 3 AEs
outcome.description: AEs and SAEs considered possibly, probably, or certainly related to study treatment, graded according to CTCAE Version 3.0 (Grade 1=Mild, Grade 2=Moderate, Grade 3=Severe, Grade 4=Life-threatening or disabling, Grade 5=Death). SAE=any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose: results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.
outcome.time_frame: Continuous assessment beginning at initiation of study drug until 30 days after the last dose of study drug
outcome.population: All-Treated participants: All participants who received at least one dose of dasatinib.

group.title: Dasatinib 70 mg
group.description: Dasatinib was administered orally at 70 mg BID, for a TDD of 140 mg.

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg
group.description: Dasatinib was administered orally at 100 mg BID, for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Serious AEs (SAEs), Drug-related AEs, Drug-related SAEs, and Drug-Related Grade 3 AEs
measure.description: AEs and SAEs considered possibly, probably, or certainly related to study treatment, graded according to CTCAE Version 3.0 (Grade 1=Mild, Grade 2=Moderate, Grade 3=Severe, Grade 4=Life-threatening or disabling, Grade 5=Death). SAE=any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose: results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.
measure.population: All-Treated participants: All participants who received at least one dose of dasatinib.

outcome.title: Number Of Participants With Notable Drug-related AEs
outcome.description: Notable drug-related AEs for dasatinib include gastrointestinal symptoms (diarrhea, nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain), fatigue, lethargy, headache, rash, fever, pleural effusion, and dyspnea.
outcome.time_frame: Continuous assessment beginning at initiation of study drug until 30 days after the last dose of study drug
outcome.population: All-Treated participants: All participants who received at least one dose of dasatinib.

measure.title: Number Of Participants With Notable Drug-related AEs

outcome.title: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Plasma Concentration of Dasatinib at Week 3
outcome.description: Blood samples (3 mL) were used for measurement of dasatinib plasma concentration and metabolites.
outcome.time_frame: PK assessment was performed at Week 3 visit (Day 15 ±4 days). Blood samples were obtained at Time = 0 hours, and at 1, 3 and 6 hours after each dose, and a trough sample was obtained immediately prior to any dose (~12 hours).
outcome.population: Number of Participants Analyzed=All Treated Participants with samples for PK analysis, n=number of participants at specified time point with samples for PK analysis

group.title: Dasatinib 70 mg
group.description: Dasatinib was administered orally at 70 mg BID, for a TDD of 140 mg.

group.description: Dasatinib was administered orally at 100 mg BID, for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg.

outcome.title: PK: Plasma Concentration of Dasatinib at Week 7 or Week 9
outcome.description: Blood samples (3 mL) were used for measurement of dasatinib plasma concentration and metabolites.
outcome.time_frame: PK assessment was performed at Week 7 or 9 visit. Blood samples were obtained at Time = 0 hours, and at 1, 3 and 6 hours after each dose, and a trough sample was obtained immediately prior to any dose (~12 hours).
outcome.population: Number of Participants Analyzed=All Treated Participants with samples for PK analysis, n=number of participants at specified time point with samples for PK analysis

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg
group.description: Dasatinib was administered orally at 100 mg BID, for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg.

group.title: Dasatinib 70 mg
group.description: Dasatinib was administered orally at 70 mg BID, for a TDD of 140 mg.

group.title: Dasatinib 50 mg
group.description: Dasatinib was administered orally at a starting dose of 70 mg BID. Dose adjustment was made according to tolerance, with reduction to 50 mg BID. Participants continued study treatment until PD or unacceptable toxicity. Dasatinib dose was adjusted so that drug-related toxicities were either Grade 0 - 1 or were Grade 2 toxicities that were adequately managed with outpatient therapy or deemed clinically acceptable.

measure.title: PK: Plasma Concentration of Dasatinib at Week 7 or Week 9
measure.description: Blood samples (3 mL) were used for measurement of dasatinib plasma concentration and metabolites.
measure.population: Number of Participants Analyzed=All Treated Participants with samples for PK analysis, n=number of participants at specified time point with samples for PK analysis

outcome.title: Pharmacodynamics: Percent Change From Baseline In Plasma Level of Collagen Type IV at Week 3 in Participants With and Without DCR
outcome.description: Collagen Type IV is a circulating marker related to the modulation of the vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF)-pathway. An assay of Collagen Type IV in plasma was performed by ELISA.
outcome.time_frame: At Baseline and Week 3 of treatment (Day 15 ±4 days)
outcome.population: Number of Participants Analyzed=All Treated Participants with samples for PD analysis, n=number of participants at specified time point with samples for PD analysis

outcome.title: Pharmacodynamics: Percent Change From Baseline In Plasma Level of VEGFR2 at Week 3 in Participants With and Without DCR
outcome.description: VEGF-stimulated disruption of the cadherin-catenin complex leads to tumor cell invasion and metastasis. VEGFR2 plasma levels were assayed by ELISA as a marker of VEGF pathway modulation.
outcome.time_frame: At Baseline and Week 3 of treatment (Day 15 ±4 days)
outcome.population: Number of Participants Analyzed=All Treated Participants with samples for PD analysis, n=number of participants at specified time point with samples for PD analysis

measure.title: Pharmacodynamics: Percent Change From Baseline In Plasma Level of VEGFR2 at Week 3 in Participants With and Without DCR
measure.description: VEGF-stimulated disruption of the cadherin-catenin complex leads to tumor cell invasion and metastasis. VEGFR2 plasma levels were assayed by ELISA as a marker of VEGF pathway modulation.
measure.population: Number of Participants Analyzed=All Treated Participants with samples for PD analysis, n=number of participants at specified time point with samples for PD analysis

outcome.title: Best Overall Response
outcome.description: Response assessed using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria: Complete Response (CR)=disappearance of all target and non-target lesions; Partial Response (PR)=≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter (LD) of target lesions; SD=small changes not meeting above criteria; Progressive Disease (PD)=appearance of new lesion(s), ≥ 20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, or progression of existing non-target lesions; Clinical Progression (cPD)=deterioration related to disease requiring treatment without radiographic PD.
outcome.time_frame: From day of first treatment through Week 25 or at time of discontinuation from study treatment
outcome.population: Evaluable population (n=69): Response Evaluable=treated participants with ≥1 measurable lesion at baseline and ≥1 on-study tumor assessment; Non-responders=treated participants with no on-study tumor response assessment due to rapid disease progression/dasatinib toxicity. One participant was not evaluable (no on-study tumor assessment).

group.title: Her2/Neu-amplified Tumor, 70 mg Twice Daily (BID) Dasatinib
group.description: Participants with a Human epidermal growth factor (Her2/neu)–amplified tumor type (defined as 3+ by immunohistochemistry [IHC] or positive by fluorescent or chromogenic in situ hybridization [FISH or CISH] regardless of estrogen receptor [ER]/progesterone receptor [PgR] status) received orally 70 mg of dasatinib twice daily (BID) for a total daily dose (TDD) of 140 mg.

group.title: Her2/Neu-amplified Tumor, 100 mg BID
group.description: Participants with a Human epidermal growth factor (Her2/neu)–amplified tumor type (defined as 3+ by immunohistochemistry [IHC] or positive by fluorescent or chromogenic in situ hybridization [FISH or CISH] regardless of estrogen receptor [ER]/progesterone receptor [PgR] status) received orally 100 mg of dasatinib twice daily (BID) for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg.

group.title: ER and/or PgR Positive Tumor, 70 mg BID Dasatinib
group.description: Participants with ER and/or PgR positive tumor types (defined as >10% of cells positive by IHC [unless Her2/neu–amplified]) received orally 70 mg of dasatinib twice daily (BID) for a total daily dose (TDD) of 140 mg.

group.title: ER and/or PgR Positive Tumor, 100 mg BID Dasatinib
group.description: Participants with ER and/or PgR positive tumor types (defined as >10% of cells positive by IHC [unless Her2/neu–amplified]) received orally 100 mg of dasatinib twice daily (BID) for a total daily dose (TDD) of 200 mg.

measure.title: Best Overall Response
measure.description: Response assessed using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria: Complete Response (CR)=disappearance of all target and non-target lesions; Partial Response (PR)=≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter (LD) of target lesions; SD=small changes not meeting above criteria; Progressive Disease (PD)=appearance of new lesion(s), ≥ 20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, or progression of existing non-target lesions; Clinical Progression (cPD)=deterioration related to disease requiring treatment without radiographic PD.
measure.population: Evaluable population (n=69): Response Evaluable=treated participants with ≥1 measurable lesion at baseline and ≥1 on-study tumor assessment; Non-responders=treated participants with no on-study tumor response assessment due to rapid disease progression/dasatinib toxicity. One participant was not evaluable (no on-study tumor assessment).

outcome.time_frame: At Baseline and Week 5 of treatment
outcome.population: Number of Participants Analyzed=All Treated Participants with samples for PD analysis, n=number of participants at specified time point with samples for PD analysis

group.title: Dasatinib
group.description: Dasatinib was administered orally at 70 mg BID (TDD=140 mg) or 100 mg BID (TDD=200 mg).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
